sentences: Sugar Belly (William Walker) was a Jamaican mento musician in the mid 20th century.
Sugar Belly's music was distinctive for his use of a homemade bamboo saxophone, as well as the bamboo fife.
There were other bamboo sax players in Jamaica, including Wilbert Stephenson, who recorded extensively with Chin's Calypso Quartet in the 1950s.

The Return Of Sugar Belly (Techniques, 1985)On top of his mento session work for artists including Count Lasher, around twenty Sugar Belly mento and reggae singles were issued in Jamaica on the Port-O-Jam, High Note, Techniques, Studio One, Calypso Joe, and Love Bond labels.
